title: Why do I feel like I sound so terrible when I'm singing? I've been singing for about 10 years, and people say I sound really good, but I still feel like I sound terrible in comparison. - Quora

response.answer_text: How you sound to yourself and how you sound to others is completely different. There are times when it is the opposite. You think you sound great and everyone else thinks you sound terrible. I would get a good piece of equipment to record yourself. I personally like the Yeti microphone (~$100). Record yourself and listen to it. You may find you have a different viewpoint.

Ask someone who is qualified, like a vocal teacher or at least someone one with experience in your line of singing to evaluate you honestly. It’s very possible that you would benefit from voice lessons. People often think they sound horrible on recordings because you hear differently (more bone conduction) inside your head.
